title: Tadoba National Park
short_description: Maharashtra's oldest national park, often called the 'Jewel of Vidarbha' for its high tiger sightings.
long_description: Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve is a tiger reserve in Chandrapur district of Maharashtra state in India. It is Maharashtra's oldest and largest national park. Created in 1955, the reserve includes the Tadoba National Park and the Andhari Wildlife Sanctuary. The park gets its name from the god 'Tadoba' or 'Taru', worshipped by the tribes who live in the dense forests of the Tadoba and Andhari region, while 'Andhari' refers to the Andhari river that meanders through the forest. It is one of India's 47 project tiger reserves. The deciduous forest is diverse, with teak and bamboo being the dominant species.
wildlife_significance: Known for having one of the fastest-growing tiger populations in the country.
guides_and_tips: Moharli is the most popular gate. Book months in advance as demand is very high.
how_to_reach: By Air: Nagpur (140 km). By Rail: Chandrapur (45 km).
permits_and_fees: Online booking via MyTadoba portal is mandatory.
conservation_notes: Successful man-animal conflict mitigation strategies in buffer zones.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Arrive Chandrapur. Check-in. Afternoon Safari in Moharli. Day 2: Morning Safari in Khutwanda. Relax. Evening Safari in Agarzari buffer zone. Day 3: Morning nature walk. Departure.
safety_tips: Summers are scorching hot (45Â°C+); carry hydration.

operating_season.peak_months: March to June (Heat brings tigers to water)
operating_season.season_notes: Buffer zones often remain open in monsoon.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Tatkal booking available at higher premium.
